author: protolambda
content: it's back up again, think one of the teams went offline for a while.

author: protolambda
content: About a 20% dip, one of the dev groups went offline likely, probably updating all nodes at once. Will check.

author: protolambda
content: By the looks of block proposals it was the lighthouse dev team with their pyrmont share. But everything seems to be up again, should be fine. cc <@!361447803194441738>

author: potuz
content: My pyrmont node is now down too, I don't think this machine could take it anymore together with my mainnet node and my everyday work on sagemath. Will update the graphs with the latest collections on slot 0 soon. It was a lot of improvements commit by commit by Teku and Lighthouse, I think prysm has improved a bit too but I don't know if they deployed those commits yet.

author: yorickdowne
content: There's a PR in the lighthouse git related to their Pyrmont share going down: https://github.com/sigp/lighthouse/pull/2130

author: potuz
content: What I don't understand from that PR is why in the first place  were the validators calling `store::beacon_state::get_full_state` on the described path 2. Surely after the first OOM kill this makes sense to catch up from the missed attestations, but i don't understand how this explains the first crash: there's no need to attest on an old head to start with
